Package a3

Class MyGame

java.lang.Object
tage.VariableFrameRateGame
a3.MyGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener
public class MyGame extends VariableFrameRateGame
MyGame is the main entry point for the game application and manages core gameplay mechanics.

While currently a prototype, this evolving project is designed as a 3D farming simulation, featuring environmental interactions, terrain systems, and multiplayer support. Current features include:

  • Real-time player control using keyboard/gamepad input
  • Dynamic terrain and skybox transitions simulating time of day
  • Camera orbit system and multi-viewport support
  • Multiplayer ghost avatars with position syncing
  • Networking setup for joining, leaving, and syncing skybox state
Planned features will include planting systems, animals, and crop mechanics.

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame()
      Configures the game's runtime state, including input handling, camera setup, and network client initialization. This method also associates keyboard and gamepad inputs to control movement and actions within the game world.
      Specified by:
      initializeGame in class VariableFrameRateGame

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the game logic every frame. Handles avatar movement, HUD updates, camera positioning, terrain height adjustment, and multiplayer state. Will later be extended to include simulation logic for farming mechanics.
      Specified by:
      update in class VariableFrameRateGame

    • getUniqueColorForClient

      public org.joml.Vector3f getUniqueColorForClient(UUID clientId)
      Generates a unique RGB color based on a client UUID. This is used to visually distinguish ghost avatars in the game world.
      Parameters:
      clientId - the UUID of the client.
      Returns:
      a Vector3f representing the RGB color.
